intro: Cryptantha debilis, commonly known as the slender cryptantha, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its delicate, branching stems and small, pea-like flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky slopes. Its flowers are usually pale blue or purple, and it produces small, lens-shaped seeds. Cryptantha debilis is adapted to arid environments and is often found in areas with well-drained soils.
